title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Stefon Diggs, with a base salary of $20 million and only $1.7 million guaranteed, could save Patriots $16.8 million if cut.
DeMario Douglas, Mack Hollins, and Kayshon Boutte are possible cut candidates, with no guaranteed money in their contracts.
Christian Barmore and Christian Elliss face potential trade or cut, with Elliss's release freeing up a few million in cap space.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not return for the Celtics' game against the 76ers as he recovers from an Achilles injury.
Philadelphia's Joel Embiid will also miss the game due to an oblique strain, likely sidelining him for three games.
The Celtics, second in the East, face their regular-season finale against the 76ers, who are sixth in the standings.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit two home runs against the Twins in a Grapefruit League game, continuing his strong spring training start.
Duran has faced struggles against left-handed pitchers but is showing improvement with two homers against lefties this week.
Despite trade rumors, Red Sox manager Alex Cora praised Duran's hitting, potentially impacting Boston's outfield lineup plans.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens and Dean Letourneau lead Boston College Bruins prospects with 39 combined goals this season.
The Bruins have seven drafted players, including top prospects Hagens and Letourneau, in the Boston College vs BU rivalry.
The Bruins' prospect pool, enhanced by multiple recent drafts, supports a swift retooling of the team.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics ranked second in Eastern Conference, 5.5 games behind Pistons, according to Boston.com report.
Unnamed Western Conference assistant coach predicts Celtics as favorites to win Eastern Conference.
Celtics' strong offensive lineup leads to higher net rating than Pistons, per ESPN commentators.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed a mix of old and new tracks at Boston's Boch Center Wang Theatre.
The concert included a balance of Americana, Southern rock, and personal songs like 'Elephant' about a friend dying of cancer.
Isbell showcased his range with a setlist featuring hits, deep cuts, and covers, closing with his 2023 hit 'King of Oklahoma.'

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots may be priced out of landing top edge rushers like Trey Hendrickson and Jaelan Phillips in free agency.
Raiders' Maxx Crosby, a potential trade target, is likely to remain with the team until at least the NFL Draft week.
Patriots could consider Missouri's Zion Young in the draft, as the team has shown interest in his performance.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance plans to purchase Warner Brothers Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
The merger may integrate CBS and TNT/TBS sports coverage, expanding platforms for MLB, NHL, and college football.
Netflix, outbid for Warner Brothers Discovery, may seek NFL rights to compete with Paramount's CBS broadcasts.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have shown interest in trading for Eagles' wide receiver A.J. Brown, but not at their current asking price.
Philadelphia reportedly seeks a first-round and second-round pick for Brown, but trading him could incur significant financial penalties.
Patriots consider keeping Stefon Diggs and acquiring Brown, but may need Diggs to restructure his contract to fit both players.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts E-ZPass is transitioning from hard-plastic transponders to RFID-enabled windshield sticker tags starting Sunday.
The new sticker tags are free and expected to save the state $7.4 million annually in production costs.
Current transponder users don't need to act, and stickers cost 55 cents compared to $6.70 for transponders.
